meanings.sent1: After the medicine wore off, the doctor had to reinject it to keep the pain away.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to reinject oil into the engine to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The balloon deflated, so I had to reinject air to keep it floating.
meanings.sent4: She had to reinject enthusiasm into her project after facing setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to reinject flavor into the dish by adding more spices.

meanings.definition: To introduce a substance back into something
meanings.sent1: The scientist needed to reinject the dye into the solution for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to reinject nutrients into the soil to improve crop growth.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally spilled paint, so they had to reinject it into the container.
meanings.sent4: The coach had to reinject motivation into the team before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The baker had to reinject moisture into the cake to prevent it from drying out.

meanings.definition: To reintroduce a previously removed element
meanings.sent1: The IT specialist had to reinject the missing code into the program to fix the bug.
meanings.sent2: The gardener had to reinject the removed plants back into the flower bed.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally erased part of the equation and had to reinject it before solving.
meanings.sent4: The architect had to reinject the original design element into the building plan.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to reinject the misplaced button back onto the shirt.
